si.JDEXi

Class Distribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • si.JDEXi.Distribution

  • public class Distribution
extends java.lang.Object
    Distribution class.

    Distribution consists of:

    • double[] distribution
    • double cumulative: holds some cumulative value, interpretation-dependent
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Marko Bohanec

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructs Distribution from another Distribution.

      Constructs Distribution from aCum/aDistr.
      Distribution(int aSize)
      Constructs Distribution of given size.

        Constructs Distribution of given size.

        Constructs Distribution from aCum/aDistr.
        Parameters:
        aCum - Initial cumulative value.
        aDistr - Initial distribution.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Get distribution size. Cumulative is not counted.
        Returns:
        Length of distribution.

      • getCumulative

        public double getCumulative()
        Get cumulative value
        Returns:
        double

      • setCumulative

        public void setCumulative(double aCumul)
        Set cumulative.
        Parameters:
        aCumul - New cumulative vaue.

      • getValue

        public double getValue(int index)
        Get distribution value at index.
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:
        value

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int index,
            double val)
        Set distribution value at index to val.
        Parameters:
        index -
        val -

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear distribution. All distribution values and cumulative are set to 0.0.

      • full

        public void full()
        Fully populate distribution. All distribution values and cumulative are set to 1.0.

      • uniform

        public void uniform()
        Create a uniform distribution with respect to the number of values. Cumulative is set to 1.0.

      • getSingle

        public int getSingle()
        Get a single value represented by distribution.
        Returns:
        If distribution holds a single element with value not equal to 0.0, returns the index of that element, otherwise returns -1.

      • setSingle

        public void setSingle(int val)
        Set the distribution to single value. The element at index val and cumulative are set to 1.0, other elements are cleared.
        Parameters:
        val -

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Count the number of non-zero elements.
        Returns:
        Count

      • getSet

        public int[] getSet()
        Represent distribution with a set of values.
        Returns:
        int[] containing indices of non-zero elements.

      • setSet

        public void setSet(int[] set)
        Convert a set into distribution.
        Parameters:
        set - int[] containing indices of distribution elements whose values are set to 1.o. Cumulative is also set to 1.0.

      • sum

        public double sum()
        Calculate the sum of distribution values.
        Returns:
        double Sum.

      • max

        public double max()
        Calculate the maximum of distribution values.
        Returns:
        double Maximum.

      • average

        public double average()
        Calculate the average of distribution values.
        Returns:
        double Average.

      • avgIndex

        public double avgIndex()
        Calculate the average index of distribution values. Warning: This is not equal to average().
        Returns:
        double Average index.

      • sumMul

        public double sumMul()
        Calculate weighted sum.
        Returns:
        cumulative * sum().

      • sumDiv

        public double sumDiv()
        Calculate sum() divided by cumulative. Returns 0.0 if cumulative==0.0.
        Returns:
        sum() / cumulative.

      • add

        public void add(Distribution aDistr)

      • add

        public void add(int index,
       double val,
       double cum)
        Increment value at index by val and cumulative by cum.
        Parameters:
        index - Element index.
        val - Value increment.
        cum - Cumulative increment.

      • add

        public void add(int index,
       double val)
        Increment value at index by val. Cumulative is increased by 1.0.
        Parameters:
        index - Element index.
        val - Value increment.

      • add

        public void add(int index)
        Increment value at index by 1.0. Cumulative is increased by 1.0.
        Parameters:
        index - Element index.

      • divBy

        public void divBy(double by)
        Divide all elements and cumulative by by.
        Parameters:
        by -

      • mulBy

        public void mulBy(double by)
        Multiply all elements and cumulative by by.
        Parameters:
        by -

      • normalize

        public void normalize(double n)
        Normalize distribution by dividing all elements by n and setting cumulative to 1.0. Warning: n==0.0 throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        n - Divisor.

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        Normalize distribution by dividing all elements by cumulative.

      • normalizeSum

        public void normalizeSum()
        Normalize distribution so that sum()==1.0.

      • normalizeMax

        public void normalizeMax()
        Normalize distribution so that max()==1.0.

      • normalizeSet

        public void normalizeSet()
        Convert distribution to a set by setting all non-zero elements and cumulative to 1.0.

      • increment

        public void increment()
        Increment distribution size by one. Insert new 0.0 element at distribution[0].

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Represent distribution with a short string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
